event.name: Algorithmic Thinking
event.description: Given tasks, write pseudocode algorithms that solve the tasks most efficiently. Scoring is based on the time complexity (Big O) of the solutions.

event.name: Programming Challenges
event.description: Write algorithmic or heuristic code to solve multiple short tasks made around a common theme. C++, Java, Python, and Javascript are allowed.

event.name: Data Science
event.description: Answer questions related to various data science topics, including statistics, neural networks, clustering, and various other topics.

event.name: Capture the Flag
event.description: Users must hide a secret (a string of text) somewhere on a website. All websites are hosted by the organization and given to other competitors, who must find the secrets.

event.name: Website Design
event.description: Design a website around a prompt that will be provided by the judges at each competition. Websites are judged based on aesthetics and functionality.

event.name: Cybersecurity
event.description: Answer questions related to various cybersecurity topics, including cryptography, privacy, internet security, and various other topics.

event.name: Bug Smasher
event.description: Given a long piece of code, find all bugs and fix them without running the code. Code is provided in C++, Java, Python, and JavaScript.

event.name: Tech Support
event.description: Talk to judges who present a case study involving a technology issue that must be fixed by providing instructions for the judges to follow.

event.name: Information Theory
event.description: Answer questions related to various information theory topics, including entropy, information compression, error correction, and various other topics.
